content: d almost finished my quilt and two she may have knitted more than one apple-leaf design when all is said and done and i don t even know if this one had been called apple-leaf i m still digging for more information but vintagekathleen blogged a version of it as new fancy work taken from a newspaper clipping in a compendium of 19th century patterns oddly enough my great aunt joan showed me her recent afghan knitted in a very close variation of mongomery s afghan pattern i love the colourful nature of my great aunt s afghan though which just shows a love of colour runs in the family nevertheless wanting to knit a small quilt as close to what i could deduce mrs lynde s design to be i chose to follow the doran pattern of 1896 adding a border of oak-leaf lace taken from the contemporaneous home work and in keeping with the knitted lace borders of the time i ve charted the patterns with minor alterations and updated terms where i modernized the pattern is in the use of color mrs lynde and montgomery herself likely used a fine white or off-white cotton i chose a smaller quilt knitted in dk-weight cotton colour-blocked in different hues of green picking up the changing colors of apple leaves and indeed the rural landscape - a nod to green gables itself below you can see the greens of my own rural neighbourhood there is a pattern for apple-leaf lace in home work if you prefer that for a matching edging although i think a more open lace complements the quilt better there s even a pattern for an apple-leaf tidy aka doily the ladies world contains a further apple-leaf stripe for a bedspread should you want to go on a full apple-leaf spree these publications are freely available online fun fact l m montgomery published a netted doily pattern in the modern priscilla january 1902 consulted a m home work a choice collection of useful designs for the crochet and knitting needle also valuable recipes for the toilet toronto rose pub co 1891 the ladies world united states s h moore & company 1896 montgomery lucy maud the selected journals of l m montgomery volume 1 1889-1910 edited by mary rubio & elizabeth waterston toronto oxford university press 1985 p 94 montgomery lucy maud l m montgomery s complete journals the ontario years 1911- 1917 canada rock s mills press 2016 p 148 vintagekathlees 1884 knitted lace sample book pattern construction method the quilt is knit flat as follows four triangles sewn together to form a square with nine squares sewn together to form the quilt the lace edging is worked separately and sewn on the sample is knit in four shades of green with leaves in the edging picking up the different shades you could knit four triangles in the round to create the square if preferred but i retained the original style of knitting and the individual
